properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=&lt;location&gt;`.

properties.name: Max
properties.help: Maximum number of nodes.

properties.name: Min
properties.help: Minimum number of nodes.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of cluster.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Workspace
properties.help: Name of workspace.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of cluster.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Workspace
properties.help: Name of workspace.

properties.name: GenerateSshKeys
properties.help: Generate SSH public and private key files in ~/.ssh directory (if missing).

properties.name: Password
properties.help: Optional password for the admin user account to be created on each compute node.

properties.name: SshKey
properties.help: Optional SSH public key value or path. If ommited and no password specified, default SSH key (~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub) will be used.

properties.name: UserName
properties.help: Name of admin user account to be created on each compute node. If the value is not provided and no user configuration is provided in the config file, current user's name will be used.

properties.name: ConfigFile
properties.help: A path to a json file containing cluster create parameters (json representation of azure.mgmt.batchai.models.ClusterCreateParameters).

properties.name: UseAutoStorage
properties.help: If provided, the command will create a storage account in a new or existing resource group named "batchaiautostorage". It will also create Azure File Share with name "batchaishare", Azure Blob Container with name "batchaicontainer". The File Share and Blob Container will be mounted on each cluster node at $AZ_BATCHAI_MOUNT_ROOT/autoafs and $AZ_BATCHAI_MOUNT_ROOT/autobfs. If the resource group already exists and contains an approapriate storage account belonging to the same region as cluster, this command will reuse existing storage account.

properties.name: AfsMountPath
properties.help: Relative mount path for Azure File share. The file share will be available at $AZ_BATCHAI_MOUNT_ROOT/<relative_mount_path> folder.

properties.name: AfsName
properties.help: Name of Azure File Share to be mounted on each cluster node. Must be used in conjunction with --storage-account-name. Multiple shares can be mounted using configuration file (see --config-file option).

properties.name: BfsMountPath
properties.help: Relative mount path for Azure Storage container. The container will be available at $AZ_BATCHAI_MOUNT_ROOT/<relative_mount_path> folder.

properties.name: BfsName
properties.help: Name of Azure Storage container to be mounted on each cluster node. Must be used in conjunction with --storage-account-name. Multiple containers can be mounted using configuration file (see --config-file option).

properties.name: StorageAccountKey
properties.help: Storage account key. Required if the storage account belongs to a different subscription. Can be specified using AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_KEY environment variable.

properties.name: StorageAccountName
properties.help: Storage account name for Azure File Shares and/or Azure Storage Containers to be mounted on each cluster node. Can be specified using AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_ACCOUNT environment variable.

properties.name: Nfs
properties.help: Name or ARM ID of a file server to be mounted on each cluster node. You need to provide full ARM ID if the file server belongs to a different workspace. Multiple NFS can be mounted using configuration file (see --config-file option).

properties.name: NfsMountPath
properties.help: Relative mount path for NFS. The NFS will be available at $AZ_BATCHAI_MOUNT_ROOT/<relative_mount_path> folder.

properties.name: CustomImage
properties.help: ARM ID of a virtual machine image to be used for nodes creation. Note, you need to provide --image containing information about the base image used for this image creation.

properties.name: Image
properties.help: Operation system image for cluster nodes. The value may contain an alias (UbuntuLTS, UbuntuDSVM) or specify image details in the form "publisher:offer:sku:version". If image configuration is not provided via command line or configuration file, Batch AI will choose default OS image.

properties.name: Max
properties.help: Max nodes count for the auto-scale cluster.

properties.name: Min
properties.help: Min nodes count for the auto-scale cluster.

properties.name: Target
properties.help: Number of nodes which should be allocated immediately after cluster creation. If the cluster is in auto-scale mode, BatchAI can change the number of nodes later based on number of running and queued jobs.

properties.name: VmPriority
properties.help: VM priority.

properties.name: VmSize
properties.help: VM size for cluster nodes (e.g. Standard_NC6 for 1 GPU node).

properties.name: SetupTask
properties.help: A command line which should be executed on each compute node when it's got allocated or rebooted. The task is executed in a bash subshell under root account.

properties.name: SetupTaskOutput
properties.help: Directory path to store where setup-task's logs. Note, Batch AI will create several helper directories under this path. The created directories are reported as stdOutErrPathSuffix by 'az cluster show' command.

properties.name: Subnet
properties.help: ARM ID of a virtual network subnet to put the cluster in.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of cluster.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Workspace
properties.help: Name of workspace.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: Yes
properties.help: Do not prompt for confirmation.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Workspace

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Target
properties.help: Target number of compute nodes.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Workspace
properties.help: Name of workspace.

properties.name: Cluster
properties.help: Name or ARM ID of the cluster to run the job. You need to provide ARM ID if the cluster belongs to a different workspace.

properties.name: ConfigFile
properties.help: A path to a json file containing job create parameters (json representation of azure.mgmt.batchai.models.JobCreateParameters).

properties.name: Experiment
properties.help: Name of experiment.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of job.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Workspace
properties.help: Name of workspace.

properties.name: AfsMountPath
properties.help: Relative mount path for Azure File Share. The File Share will be available at $AZ_BATCHAI_JOB_MOUNT_ROOT/<relative_mount_path> folder.

properties.name: AfsName
properties.help: Name of Azure File Share to mount during the job execution. The File Share will be mounted only on the nodes which are executing the job. Must be used in conjunction with --storage-account-name.  Multiple shares can be mounted using configuration file (see --config-file option).

properties.name: BfsMountPath
properties.help: Relative mount path for Azure Storage Blob Container. The container will be available at $AZ_BATCHAI_JOB_MOUNT_ROOT/<relative_mount_path> folder.

properties.name: BfsName
properties.help: Name of Azure Storage Blob Container to mount during the job execution. The container will be mounted only on the nodes which are executing the job. Must be used in conjunction with --storage-account-name. Multiple containers can be mounted using configuration file (see --config-file option).

properties.name: StorageAccountKey
properties.help: Storage account key. Required if the storage account belongs to a different subscription. Can be specified using AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_KEY environment variable.

properties.name: StorageAccountName
properties.help: Storage account name for Azure File Shares and/or Azure Storage Containers to be mounted on each cluster node. Can be specified using AZURE_BATCHAI_STORAGE_ACCOUNT environment variable.

properties.name: Nfs
properties.help: Name or ARM ID of the file server to be mounted during the job execution. You need to provide ARM ID if the file server belongs to a different workspace. You can configure multiple file servers using job's  configuration file.

properties.name: NfsMountPath
properties.help: Relative mount path for NFS. The NFS will be available at $AZ_BATCHAI_JOB_MOUNT_ROOT/<relative_mount_path> folder.

properties.name: Experiment
properties.help: Name of experiment.

properties.help: Polling interval in sec.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location of the workspace. If omitted, the location of the resource group will be used.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of file server.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure a default value by setting up default workspace using `az batchai workspace set-default`.

properties.name: Workspace
properties.help: Name or ARM ID of the workspace. You can configure default workspace using `az batchai workspace set-default`.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: VmSize
properties.help: VM size.

properties.name: GenerateSshKeys
properties.help: Generate SSH public and private key files in ~/.ssh directory (if missing).

properties.name: Password
properties.help: Optional password for the admin user created on the NFS node.

properties.name: SshKey
properties.help: Optional SSH public key value or path. If ommited and no password specified, default SSH key (~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub) will be used.

properties.name: UserName
properties.help: Name of admin user account to be created on NFS node. If the value is not provided and no user configuration is provided in the config file, current user's name will be used.

properties.name: ConfigFile
properties.help: A path to a json file containing file server create parameters (json representation of azure.mgmt.batchai.models.FileServerCreateParameters). Note, parameters given via command line will overwrite parameters specified in the configuration file.

properties.name: CachingType
properties.help: Caching type for premium disks. If not provided via command line or in configuration file, no caching will be used.

properties.name: DiskCount
properties.help: Number of disks.

properties.name: DiskSize
properties.help: Disk size in Gb.

properties.name: StorageSku
properties.help: The sku of storage account to persist VM.

properties.name: Subnet
properties.help: ARM ID of a virtual network subnet to put the file server in. If not provided via command line or in the configuration file, Batch AI will create a new virtual network and subnet under your subscription.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of file server.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Address
properties.help: Specifies that connections to the given TCP port or Unix socket on the local (client) host are to be forwarded to the given host and port, or Unix socket, on the remote side. e.g. -L 8080:localhost:8080.

properties.name: Exec
properties.help: Optional command line to be executed on the node. If not provided, the command will perform ports forwarding only.

properties.name: NodeId
properties.help: ID of the node to forward the ports to. If not provided, the command will be executed on the first available node.

properties.name: Password
properties.help: Optional password to establish SSH connection.

properties.name: SshPrivateKey
properties.help: Optional SSH private key path to establish SSH connection. If omitted, the default SSH private key will be used.

properties.name: Expiry
properties.help: Time in minutes for how long generated download URL should remain valid.

properties.name: OutputDirectoryId
properties.help: The Id of the job's output directory (as specified by "id" element in outputDirectories collection in the job create parameters).

properties.name: Path
properties.help: Relative path in the given output directory.

properties.name: Exec

properties.name: NodeId

properties.name: Password

commonTaskProperties.name: Debug
commonTaskProperties.help: Increase logging verbosity to show all debug logs.

commonTaskProperties.name: Help
commonTaskProperties.help: Show this help message and exit.

commonTaskProperties.help: JMESPath query string. See http://jmespath.org/ for more information and examples.
